verses.verse: (A Song of Ascents, of David.) O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> is not proud, <S%H1361><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> my eyes <S%H5869><s%> haughty; <S%H7311><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> do I involve <S%H1980><s%> myself in great <S%H1419><s%> matters, Or in things <S%H6381><s%> too <S%H4480><s%> difficult <S%H6381><s%> for me.

Surely <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> I have composed <S%H9586><s%> and quieted <S%H1826><s%> my soul; <S%H5315><s%> Like a weaned <S%H1580><s%> child [rests] against <S%H5921><s%> his mother, <S%H517><s%> My soul <S%H5315><s%> is like a weaned <S%H1580><s%> child within <S%H5921><s%> me.
O Israel, <S%H3478><s%> hope <S%H3176><s%> in the Lord <S%H3068><s%> From this <S%H6258><s%> time <S%H6258><s%> forth and forever. <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5769><s%>
